revised_title: The Action of Light on Selenium: An Investigation into the Effects of Different Light Sources and Absorbing Media
tldr: This study investigates the effects of light on the electrical resistance of selenium and explores the influence of various light sources and absorbing media. The author finds that exposure to light decreases the resistance of selenium, and that the action is primarily due to the illuminating power of the light. The sensitivity of selenium to light increases with time spent in the dark, and the yellowish-green rays appear to be the most effective in altering the electrical state of the material.
